sections.title: Teeth whitening in Shoreham-by-Sea
sections.body: Dentist-led whitening that follows UK regulations, uses custom trays, and sets the shade for the rest of your smile plan. We map whitening into Align → Bleach → Composite or veneer routes so results look natural and stay comfortable.
bullets: Custom-fit trays made from digital scans
UK-permitted gels prescribed and supervised by your dentist
Shade targets that respect enamel, gums, and existing restorations
Sequenced with aligners, bonding, or veneers so shade is locked in first

sections.title: Clinical oversight that keeps whitening safe
items: Care delivered under UK regulations with prescriptions matched to your oral health
Assessment for decay, gum health, and restorations before starting
Protective, custom trays that direct gel safely and evenly
Clinical monitoring to stop treatment if sensitivity or concerns arise
Documentation that keeps results traceable for future smile work

sections.title: Measured change with custom trays and follow-up
sections.body: Home whitening uses lab-made trays and dentist-prescribed gels to keep progress gradual and comfortable. Over-the-counter strips and pens cannot be customised to your enamel, so shade changes are less predictable and can irritate gums.
bullets: Custom trays from digital scans for sealed, even gel placement
Planned, gradual whitening with check-ins to review comfort
Guidance to reduce sensitivity and protect gums
Advice on how whitening interacts with veneers, crowns, and fillings
Clear steps for top-ups using the same trays when indicated

sections.title: Protocols that keep whitening comfortable
sections.body: We stage whitening in planned blocks, use desensitising pastes or gels, and pause treatment if symptoms persist. Your dentist adjusts wear times or gel selection so comfort leads the plan.

sections.eyebrow: Whitening as part of ABC dentistry
sections.title: Align → Bleach → Composite or veneers
sections.body: We set the sequence so shade and shape work together. Teeth are aligned first if needed, whitening sets the baseline shade, then composite bonding or veneers are matched to that colour. This order avoids mismatched restorations and keeps future maintenance straightforward.
bullets: Aligners or orthodontics establish positions before shade work
Whitening locks in a natural shade to match future composites or veneers
Composite or porcelain is planned after bleaching to avoid re-making restorations
Review points keep the plan compliant and comfortable at every stage

faqs.question: Is dentist-led whitening safe?
faqs.answer: Yes. Whitening is only started after a clinical assessment and uses UK-permitted gels in custom trays to protect enamel and gums.

faqs.question: What if my teeth feel sensitive?
faqs.answer: We use staged wear times, desensitising toothpaste or gels, and can pause treatment until symptoms settle. Your dentist adapts the plan if sensitivity persists.

faqs.question: How long do results last?
faqs.answer: Results are maintained with good hygiene, mindful diet, and scheduled top-ups. We advise when to refresh so shade stays stable without over-whitening.

faqs.question: Do I need top-ups?
faqs.answer: Top-ups are planned around your exams or hygiene visits and use your existing trays. They are only recommended when clinically appropriate to keep shade balanced.
